abs.description: Returns the absolute value of a number

acad-pop-dbmod.description: Restores the value of the DBMOD system variable to the value that was most recently stored with acad-push-dbmod

acad-push-dbmod.description: Stores the current value of the DBMOD system variable

acad_colordlg.description: Displays the standard AutoCAD color selection dialog box

acad_strlsort.description: Sorts a list of strings in alphabetical order

acdimenableupdate.description: Controls the automatic updating of associative dimensions

acet-layerp-mark.description: Places beginning and ending marks for Layer Previous recording

acet-layerp-mode.description: Queries and sets the LAYERPMODE setting

acet-laytrans.description: Translates drawing layers to standards defined in another drawing or standards file

acet-ms-to-ps.description: Converts a real value from model space units to paper space units

acet-ps-to-ms.description: Converts a real value from paper space units to model space units

action_tile.description: Assigns an action to evaluate when the user selects the specified tile in a dialog box

+.description: Returns the sum of all numbers

add_list.description: Adds or modifies a string in the currently active dialog box list

alert.description: Displays a dialog box containing an error or warning message

alloc.description: Sets the size of the segment to be used by the expand function

and.description: Returns the logical AND of the supplied arguments

angle.description: Returns an angle in radians of a line defined by two endpoints

angtof.description: Converts a string representing an angle into a real (floating-point) value in radians

angtos.description: Converts an angular value in radians into a string

append.description: Takes any number of lists and appends them together as one list

apply.description: Passes a list of arguments to, and executes, a specified function

ascii.description: Returns the conversion of the first character of a string into its ASCII character code (an integer)

assoc.description: Searches an association list for an element and returns that association list entry

atan.description: Returns the arctangent of a number in radians

atof.description: Converts a string into a real number

atoi.description: Converts a string into an integer

atom.description: Verifies that an item is an atom

atoms-family.description: Returns a list of the currently defined symbols

autoarxload.description: Predefines command names to load an associated ObjectARX file

autoload.description: Predefines command names to load an associated AutoLISP file

~.description: Returns the bitwise NOT (1's complement) of the argument

boole.description: Serves as a general bitwise Boolean function

boundp.description: Verifies if a value is bound to a symbol

caddr.description: Returns the third element of a list

cadr.description: Returns the second element of a list

car.description: Returns the first element of a list

cdr.description: Returns a list containing all but the first element of the specified list

chr.description: Converts an integer representing an ASCII character code into a single-character string

client_data_tile.description: Associates application-managed data with a dialog box tile

command-s.description: Executes an AutoCAD command and the supplied input

cond.description: Serves as the primary conditional function for AutoLISP

cons.description: Adds an element to the beginning of a list, or constructs a dotted list

cos.description: Returns the cosine of an angle expressed in radians

cvunit.description: Converts a value from one unit of measurement to another

defun-q-list-ref.description: Displays the list structure of a function defined with defun-q

defun-q-list-set.description: Sets the value of a symbol to be a function defined by a list

defun-q.description: Defines a function as a list

dictadd.description: Adds a nongraphical object to the specified dictionary

dictnext.description: Finds the next item in a dictionary

dictremove.description: Removes an entry from the specified dictionary

dictsearch.description: Searches a dictionary for an item

dimx_tile.description: Retrieves the width of a tile in dialog box units

distof.description: Converts a string that represents a real (floating-point) value into a real value

end_image.description: Ends creation of the currently active dialog box image

end_list.description: Ends processing of the currently active dialog box list

entdel.description: Deletes objects (entities) or restores previously deleted objects

entlast.description: Returns the name of the last nondeleted main object (entity) in the drawing

entmake.description: Creates a new entity in the drawing

entmakex.description: Makes a new object or entity, gives it a handle and entity name (but does not assign an owner), and then returns the new entity name

entmod.description: Modifies the definition data of an object (entity)

entnext.description: Returns the name of the next object (entity) in the drawing

entsel.description: Prompts the user to select a single object (entity) by specifying a point

entupd.description: Updates the screen image of an object (entity)

eq.description: Determines whether two expressions are identical

equal.description: Determines whether two expressions are equal

eval.description: Returns the result of evaluating an AutoLISP expression

exit.description: Forces the current application to quit

exp.description: Returns the constant e (a real number) raised to a specified power (the natural antilog)

expt.description: Returns a number raised to a specified power

fill_image.description: Draws a filled rectangle in the currently active dialog box image tile

findfile.description: Searches the AutoCAD library and trusted paths for the specified file or directory

findtrustedfile.description: Searches the AutoCAD trusted locations for the specified file

fix.description: Returns the conversion of a real number into the nearest smaller integer

float.description: Returns the conversion of a number into a real number

foreach.description: Evaluates expressions for all members of a list

function.description: Tells the Visual LISP compiler to link and optimize an argument as if it were a built-in function

gc.description: Forces a garbage collection, which frees up unused memory

gcd.description: Returns the greatest common denominator of two integers

getangle.description: Pauses for user input of an angle, and returns that angle in radians

getcfg.description: Obsolete. Retrieves application data from the AppData section of the acad20xx.cfg file

getcname.description: Retrieves the localized or English name of an AutoCAD command

getcorner.description: Pauses for user input of a rectangle's second corner

getdist.description: Pauses for user input of a distance

getenv.description: Returns the string value assigned to a system environment variable

getfiled.description: Prompts the user for a file name with the standard AutoCAD file dialog box, and returns that file name

getint.description: Pauses for user input of an integer, and returns that integer

getkword.description: Pauses for user input of a keyword, and returns that keyword

getorient.description: Pauses for user input of an angle, and returns that angle in radians

getpoint.description: Pauses for user input of a point, and returns that point

getpropertyvalue.description: Returns the current value of an entity¡¯s property

getreal.description: Pauses for user input of a real number, and returns that real number

getstring.description: Pauses for user input of a string, and returns that string

getvar.description: Retrieves the value of an AutoCAD system variable

get_attr.description: Retrieves the DCL value of a dialog box attribute

get_tile.description: Retrieves the current runtime value of a dialog box tile

grdraw.description: Draws a vector between two points, in the current viewport

>.description: Returns T if each argument is numerically greater than the argument to its right; otherwise returns nil

grread.description: Reads values from any of the AutoCAD input devices

grtext.description: Writes text to the status line or to screen menu areas

grvecs.description: Draws multiple vectors in the drawing area

handent.description: Returns an object (entity) name based on its handle

initcommandversion.description: Forces the next command to run with the specified version
Forces the next command to run with the specified version

initdia.description: Forces the display of the next command's dialog box

initget.description: Establishes keywords for use by the next user-input function call

inters.description: Finds the intersection of two lines

ispropertyreadonly.description: Returns the read-only state of an entity¡¯s property

itoa.description: Returns the conversion of an integer into a string

last.description: Returns the last element in a list

layerstate-addlayers.description: Adds or updates a series of layers to a layer state

layerstate-compare.description: Compares a layer state to the layers in the current drawing

layerstate-export.description: Exports a layer state to a specified file

layerstate-getlastrestored.description: Returns the name of the last restored layer state in the current drawing

layerstate-getlayers.description: Returns the layers saved in a layer state

layerstate-getnames.description: Returns a list of the layer state names

layerstate-has.description: Checks if a layer state is present

layerstate-import.description: Imports a layer state from a specified file

layerstate-importfromdb.description: Imports a layer state from a specified drawing file

layerstate-removelayers.description: Removes a list of layers from a layer state

layerstate-restore.description: Restores a layer state into the current drawing

layerstate-save.description: Saves a layer state in the current drawing

layoutlist.description: Returns a list of all paper space layouts in the current drawing

length.description: Returns an integer indicating the number of elements in a list

<.description: Returns T if each argument is numerically less than the argument to its right; otherwise nil

listp.description: Verifies that an item is a list

log.description: Returns the natural log of a number as a real number

logand.description: Returns the result of the logical bitwise AND of a list of integers

logior.description: Returns the result of the logical bitwise inclusive OR of a list of integers

lsh.description: Returns the logical bitwise shift of an integer by a specified number of bits

mapcar.description: Returns a list that is the result of executing a function with a list (or lists) supplied as arguments to the function

max.description: Returns the largest of the numbers given

mem.description: Displays the current state of the AutoLISP memory

member.description: Searches a list for an occurrence of an expression and returns the remainder of the list, starting with the first occurrence of the expression

menucmd.description: Issues menu commands, or sets and retrieves menu item status

menugroup.description: Verifies that a menugroup is loaded

min.description: Returns the smallest of the numbers given

minusp.description: Verifies that a number is negative

mode_tile.description: Sets the mode of a dialog box tile

*.description: Returns the product of all numbers

namedobjdict.description: Returns the entity name of the current drawing's named object dictionary, which is the root of all nongraphical objects in the drawing

nentsel.description: Prompts the user to select an object (entity) by specifying a point, and provides access to the definition data contained within a complex object

nentselp.description: Provides similar functionality to that of the nentsel function without the need for user input

new_dialog.description: Begins a new dialog box and displays it, and can also specify a default action

not.description: Verifies that an item evaluates to nil

nth.description: Returns the nth element of a list

null.description: Verifies that an item is bound to nil

numberp.description: Verifies that an item is a real number or an integer

or.description: Returns the logical OR of a list of expressions

polar.description: Returns the UCS 3D point at a specified angle and distance from a point

*pop-error-mode*.description: Error-handling function that ends the previous call to *push-error-using-command* or *push-error-using-stack*

prin1.description: Prints an expression to the command line or writes an expression to an open file

princ.description: Prints an expression to the command line, or writes an expression to an open file

print.description: Prints an expression to the command line, or writes an expression to an open file

progn.description: Evaluates each expression sequentially and returns the value of the last expression

prompt.description: Displays a string on your screen's prompt area

*push-error-using-command*.description: Error-handling function that indicates the use of the command function within a custom *error* handler

*push-error-using-stack*.description: Error-handling function that indicates the use of variables from the AutoLISP stack within a custom *error* handler

quote.description: Returns an expression without evaluating it

read-char.description: Returns the decimal ASCII code representing the character read from the keyboard input buffer or from an open file

read-line.description: Reads a string from the keyboard or from an open file, until an end-of-line marker is encountered

read.description: Returns the first list or atom obtained from a string

regapp.description: Registers an application name with the current AutoCAD drawing in preparation for using extended object data

rem.description: Divides the first number by the second, and returns the remainder

repeat.description: Evaluates each expression a specified number of times, and returns the value of the last expression

rtos.description: Converts a number into a string

set.description: Sets the value of a quoted symbol name to an expression

setcfg.description: Obsolete. Writes application data to the AppData section of the acad20xx.cfg file

setenv.description: Sets a system environment variable to a specified value

setfunhelp.description: Registers a user-defined command with the Help facility so the appropriate Help file and topic are called when the user requests help on that command

setpropertyvalue.description: Sets the property value for an entity

setq.description: Sets the value of a symbol or symbols to associated expressions

setview.description: Establishes a view for a specified viewport

set_tile.description: Sets the value of a dialog box tile

showhtmlmodalwindow.description: Displays a modal dialog box with a specified URI (Uniform Resource Identifier)

sin.description: Returns the sine of an angle as a real number expressed in radians

slide_image.description: Displays an AutoCAD slide in the currently active dialog box image tile

snvalid.description: Checks the symbol table name for valid characters

sqrt.description: Returns the square root of a number as a real number

ssadd.description: Adds an object (entity) to a selection set, or creates a new selection set

ssdel.description: Deletes an object (entity) from a selection set

ssget.description: Creates a selection set from the selected object

ssgetfirst.description: Determines which objects are selected and gripped

sslength.description: Returns an integer containing the number of objects (entities) in a selection set

ssmemb.description: Tests whether an object (entity) is a member of a selection set

ssname.description: Returns the object (entity) name of the indexed element of a selection set

ssnamex.description: Retrieves information about how a selection set was created.

sssetfirst.description: Sets which objects are selected and gripped

start_dialog.description: Displays a dialog box and begins accepting user input

start_image.description: Starts the creation of an image in the dialog box tile

start_list.description: Starts the processing of a list in the list box or in the pop-up list dialog box tile

strcase.description: Returns a string where all alphabetic characters have been converted to uppercase or lowercase

strcat.description: Returns a string that is the concatenation of multiple strings

strlen.description: Returns an integer that is the number of characters in a string

subst.description: Searches a list for an old item and returns a copy of the list with a new item substituted in place of every occurrence of the old item

substr.description: Returns a substring of a string

tblnext.description: Finds the next item in a symbol table

tblobjname.description: Returns the entity name of a specified symbol table entry

tblsearch.description: Searches a symbol table for a symbol name

term_dialog.description: Terminates all current dialog boxes as if the user had canceled each of them

terpri.description: Prints a newline to the command line

textbox.description: Measures a specified text object, and returns the diagonal coordinates of a box that encloses the text

textpage.description: Switches focus from the drawing area to the text screen

trans.description: Translates a point (or a displacement) from one coordinate system to another

type.description: Returns the type of a specified item

untrace.description: Clears the trace flag for the specified functions

vector_image.description: Draws a vector in the currently active dialog box image

ver.description: Returns a string that contains the current AutoLISP version number

vl-acad-defun.description: Defines an AutoLISP function symbol as an external subroutine

vl-acad-undefun.description: Undefines an AutoLISP function symbol so it is no longer available to ObjectARX applications

vl-arx-import.description: Imports ObjectARX/ADSRX functions into a separate-namespace VLX

vl-bb-ref.description: Returns the value of a variable from the blackboard namespace

vl-bb-set.description: Sets a variable in the blackboard namespace

vl-catch-all-apply.description: Passes a list of arguments to a specified function and traps any exceptions

vl-catch-all-error-message.description: Returns a string from an error object

vl-catch-all-error-p.description: Determines whether an argument is an error object returned from vl-catch-all-apply

vl-consp.description: Determines whether or not a list is nil

vl-directory-files.description: Lists all files in a given directory

vl-doc-export.description: Makes a function available to the current document

vl-doc-import.description: Imports a previously exported function into a VLX namespace

vl-doc-ref.description: Retrieves the value of a variable from the current document's namespace

vl-doc-set.description: Sets the value of a variable in the current document's namespace

vl-every.description: Checks whether the predicate is true for every element combination

vl-exit-with-error.description: Passes control from an error handler to the *error* function of the calling namespace

vl-exit-with-value.description: Returns a value to the function that invoked the *error* handler from another namespace

vl-file-copy.description: Copies or appends the contents of one file to another file

vl-file-directory-p.description: Determines if a file name refers to a directory

vl-file-size.description: Determines the size of a file, in bytes

vl-file-systime.description: Returns last modification time of the specified file

vl-filename-base.description: Returns the name of a file, after stripping out the directory path and extension

vl-filename-directory.description: Returns the directory path of a file, after stripping out the name and extension

vl-filename-extension.description: Returns the extension from a file name, after stripping out the rest of the name

vl-filename-mktemp.description: Calculates a unique file name to be used for a temporary file

vl-get-resource.description: Returns the text stored in a .txt file packaged in a VLX

vl-list-length.description: Calculates list length of a true list

vl-list-loaded-vlx.description: Returns a list of all separate-namespace VLX files associated with the current document

vl-list->string.description: Combines the characters associated with a list of integers into a string

vl-load-all.description: Loads a file into all open AutoCAD documents, and into any document subsequently opened during the current AutoCAD session

vl-load-com.description: Loads the extended AutoLISP functions related to ActiveX support

vl-member-if-not.description: Determines if the predicate is nil for one of the list members

vl-member-if.description: Determines if the predicate is true for one of the list members

vl-position.description: Returns the index of the specified list item

vl-prin1-to-string.description: Returns the string representation of LISP data as if it were output by the prin1 function

vl-princ-to-string.description: Returns the string representation of LISP data as if it were output by the princ function

vl-propagate.description: Copies the value of a variable into all open document namespaces (and sets its value in any subsequent drawings opened during the current AutoCAD session)

vl-registry-delete.description: Deletes the specified key from the Windows Registry or property list file on Mac OS

vl-registry-descendents.description: Returns a list of subkeys or value names for the specified key of the Windows Registry or property list file on Mac OS

vl-registry-read.description: Returns data stored by a specific key/value pair in the Windows Registry or property list file on Mac OS

vl-registry-write.description: Creates a key in the Windows Registry or property list file on Mac OS

vl-remove-if-not.description: Returns all elements of the supplied list that pass the test function

vl-remove-if.description: Returns all elements of the supplied list that fail the test function

vl-some.description: Checks whether the predicate is not nil for one element combination

vl-sort-i.description: Sorts the elements in a list according to a given compare function, and returns the element index numbers

vl-sort.description: Sorts the elements in a list according to a given compare function

vl-string-elt.description: Returns the ASCII representation of the character at a specified position in a string

vl-string-left-trim.description: Removes the specified characters from the beginning of a string

vl-string-mismatch.description: Returns the length of the longest common prefix for two strings, starting at specified positions

vl-string-position.description: Looks for a character with the specified ASCII code in a string

vl-string-right-trim.description: Removes the specified characters from the end of a string

vl-string-search.description: Searches for the specified pattern in a string

vl-string-subst.description: Substitutes one string for another, within a string

vl-string-translate.description: Replaces characters in a string with a specified set of characters

vl-string-trim.description: Removes the specified characters from the beginning and end of a string

vl-string->list.description: Converts a string into a list of character codes

vl-symbol-name.description: Returns a string containing the name of a symbol

vl-symbol-value.description: Returns the current value bound to a symbol

vl-symbolp.description: Identifies whether or not a specified object is a symbol

vl-unload-vlx.description: Unload a VLX application that is loaded in its own namespace

vl-vlx-loaded-p.description: Determines whether a separate-namespace VLX is currently loaded

vlax-add-cmd.description: Adds commands to the AutoCAD built-in command set

vlax-create-object.description: Creates a new instance of an application object

vlax-curve-getArea.description: Returns the area inside the curve

vlax-curve-getClosestPointTo.description: Returns the point (in WCS) on a curve that is nearest to the specified point

vlax-curve-getClosestPointToProjection.description: Returns the closest point (in WCS) on a curve after projecting the curve onto a plane

vlax-curve-getDistAtParam.description: Returns the length of the curve's segment from the curve's beginning to the specified parameter

vlax-curve-getDistAtPoint.description: Returns the length of the curve's segment between the curve's start point and the specified point

vlax-curve-getEndParam.description: Returns the parameter of the endpoint of the curve

vlax-curve-getEndPoint.description: Returns the endpoint (in WCS) of the curve

vlax-curve-getFirstDeriv.description: Returns the first derivative (in WCS) of a curve at the specified location

vlax-curve-getParamAtDist.description: Returns the parameter of a curve at the specified distance from the beginning of the curve

vlax-curve-getParamAtPoint.description: Returns the parameter of the curve at the point

vlax-curve-getPointAtDist.description: Returns the point (in WCS) along a curve at the distance specified by the user

vlax-curve-getPointAtParam.description: Returns the point at the specified parameter value along a curve

vlax-curve-getSecondDeriv.description: Returns the second derivative (in WCS) of a curve at the specified location

vlax-curve-getStartParam.description: Returns the start parameter on the curve

vlax-curve-getStartPoint.description: Returns the start point (in WCS) of the curve

vlax-curve-isClosed.description: Determines if the specified curve is closed (that is, the start point is the same as the endpoint)

vlax-curve-isPeriodic.description: Determines if the specified curve has an infinite range in both directions and there is a period value dT, such that a point on the curve at (u + dT) = point on curve (u), for any parameter u

vlax-curve-isPlanar.description: Determines if there is a plane that contains the curve

vlax-dump-object.description: Lists an object's properties, and optionally, the methods that apply to the object

vlax-ename->vla-object.description: Transforms an entity to a VLA-object

vlax-erased-p.description: Determines whether an object was erased

vlax-for.description: Iterates through a collection of objects, evaluating each expression

vlax-get-acad-object.description: Retrieves the top level AutoCAD application object for the current AutoCAD session

vlax-get-object.description: Returns a running instance of an application object

vlax-get-or-create-object.description: Returns a running instance of an application object, or creates a new instance if the application is not currently running

vlax-import-type-library.description: Imports information from a type library

vlax-ldata-delete.description: Erases LISP data from a drawing dictionary

vlax-ldata-get.description: Retrieves LISP data from a drawing dictionary or an object

vlax-ldata-list.description: Lists AutoLISP data in a drawing dictionary

vlax-ldata-put.description: Stores LISP data in a drawing dictionary or an object

vlax-ldata-test.description: Determines if data can be saved over a session boundary

vlax-machine-product-key.description: Returns the AutoCAD Windows registry path in the HKLM (HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE)

vlax-map-collection.description: Applies a function to all objects in a collection

vlax-method-applicable-p.description: Determines if an object supports a particular method

vlax-object-released-p.description: Determines if an object has been released

vlax-product-key.description: Returns the AutoCAD Windows registry path

vlax-property-available-p.description: Determines if an object has a specified property

vlax-put-property.description: Sets the property of an ActiveX object

vlax-read-enabled-p.description: Determines if an object can be read

vlax-remove-cmd.description: Removes a single command or a command group

vlax-safearray-fill.description: Stores data in the elements of a safearray

vlax-safearray-get-dim.description: Returns the number of dimensions in a safearray object

vlax-safearray-get-element.description: Returns an element from an array

vlax-safearray-get-l-bound.description: Returns the lower boundary (starting index) of a dimension of an array

vlax-safearray-get-u-bound.description: Returns the upper boundary (end index) of a dimension of an array

vlax-safearray-put-element.description: Adds an element to an array

vlax-safearray-type.description: Returns the data type of a safearray

vlax-safearray->list.description: Returns the elements of a safearray in list form

vlax-tmatrix.description: Returns a suitable representation for a 4 x 4 transformation matrix to be used in VLA methods

vlax-typeinfo-available-p.description: Determines whether TypeLib information is present for the specified type of object

vlax-user-product-key.description: Returns the AutoCAD Windows registry path in the HKCU (HKEY_CURRENT_USER)

vlax-variant-change-type.description: Returns the value of a variant after changing it from one data type to another

vlax-variant-type.description: Determines the data type of a variant

vlax-variant-value.description: Returns the value of a variant

vlax-vla-object->ename.description: Transforms a VLA-object to an AutoLISP entity

vlax-write-enabled-p.description: Determines if an AutoCAD drawing object can be modified

vlisp-compile.description: Compiles AutoLISP source code into a FAS file

vlr-acdb-reactor.description: Constructs a reactor object that notifies when an object is added to, modified in, or erased from a drawing database

vlr-added-p.description: Tests to determine if a reactor object is enabled

vlr-command-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor that notifies of a command event

vlr-current-reaction-name.description: Returns the name (symbol) of the current event, if called from within a reactor's callback

vlr-data-set.description: Overwrites application-specific data associated with a reactor

vlr-data.description: Returns application-specific data associated with a reactor

vlr-deepclone-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of a deep clone event

vlr-docmanager-reactor.description: Constructs a reactor object that notifies of events relating to drawing documents

vlr-dwg-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of a drawing event (for example, opening or closing a drawing file)

vlr-dxf-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of an event related to reading or writing a DXF file

vlr-insert-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of an event related to block insertion

vlr-linker-reactor.description: Constructs a reactor object that notifies your application every time an ObjectARX application is loaded or unloaded

vlr-lisp-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of a LISP event

vlr-miscellaneous-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that does not fall under any other editor reactor types

vlr-mouse-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of a mouse event (for example, a double-click)

vlr-notification.description: Determines whether or not a reactor will fire if its associated namespace is not active

vlr-object-reactor.description: Constructs a drawing object reactor object

vlr-owner-add.description: Adds an object to the list of owners of an object reactor

vlr-owner-remove.description: Removes an object from the list of owners of an object reactor

vlr-owners.description: Returns the list of owners of an object reactor

vlr-pers-list.description: Returns a list of persistent reactors in the current drawing document

vlr-pers-p.description: Determines whether a reactor is persistent

vlr-reaction-name.description: Returns a list of all possible callback conditions for this reactor type

vlr-reaction-set.description: Adds or replaces a callback function in a reactor

vlr-reactions.description: Returns a list of pairs (event-name . callback_function) for the reactor

vlr-reactors.description: Returns a list of existing reactors

vlr-remove-all.description: Disables all reactors of the specified type

vlr-set-notification.description: Defines whether a reactor's callback function will execute if its associated namespace is not active

vlr-sysvar-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of a change to a system variable

vlr-toolbar-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of a change to the bitmaps in a toolbar

vlr-trace-reaction.description: A predefined callback function that prints one or more callback arguments in the Trace window

vlr-type.description: Returns a symbol representing the reactor type

vlr-types.description: Returns a list of all reactor types

vlr-undo-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of an undo event

vlr-wblock-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of an event related to writing a block

vlr-window-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of an event related to moving or sizing an AutoCAD window

vlr-xref-reactor.description: Constructs an editor reactor object that notifies of an event related to attaching or modifying XREFs

wcmatch.description: Performs a wild-card pattern match on a string

while.description: Evaluates a test expression, and if it is not nil, evaluates other expressions; repeats this process until the test expression evaluates to nil

write-char.description: Writes one character to the screen or to an open file

write-line.description: Writes a string to the screen or to an open file

xdroom.description: Returns the amount of extended data (xdata) space that is available for an object (entity)

xdsize.description: Returns the size (in bytes) that a list occupies when it is linked to an object (entity) as extended data

zerop.description: Verifies that a number evaluates to zero
